properties.areaDesc: Davidson, NC; Forsyth, NC; Guilford, NC; Randolph, NC
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 7:21PM EST until January 24 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Raleigh NC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for Poor Drainage Areas
for...
Eastern Forsyth County in central North Carolina...
Eastern Davidson County in central North Carolina...
Randolph County in central North Carolina...
Guilford County in central North Carolina...

* Until 915 PM EST.

* At 718 PM EST, Doppler radar a line of showers and isolated
thunderstorms with very heavy rain extending from Thomasville to
High Point and Greensboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. Very heavy
rain with rainfall rates of nearly 0.75 inches in 30 minutes was
falling. This will cause urban and small stream flooding
especially in High Point and Greensboro. The heaviest rain will
fall over northern Randolph and Guilford Counties through 800 PM.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Greensboro, High Point, Asheboro, Randleman, North Carolina Zoo,
Thomasville, Kernersville, Seagrove, McLeansville and Archdale.
